channel.title: Maxing out my Mac Mini
channel.description: Ok so, I've installed 8GB RAM and a 1TB HD. It's original processor is a 2.0 GHz Intel Core 2 Duo, and I'm thinking about seeing into slapping in a Quad-Core type deal, does anyone know if it's possible? Also go ahead and discuss what you guys are doing with your computers, fun fun. :D

item.title: Maxing out my Mac Mini
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

Intel > AMD because of hyperthreading. Hexa core AMD = 6 cores. Hexa core Intel = 6 cores but 12 logic cores due to hyperthreading. Wich gives Intel a huge performance.

Read full topic

item.title: Maxing out my Mac Mini
item.dc:creator: @shrogg shrogg
item.description:
@shrogg wrote:

Its all to do with their hyperthredding. which is impressive.
and also, i mean 3.3ghz stock
If i had the money, i would buy a intel processor, but the hex core is working perfectly.
and for games that use multicore rendering, WOW, its… insane…

Read full topic

Ok well, 1.6kUSD = 1.9kNZD so then it’s 400$ more.

3.4 GHZ stock, and my Mobo has a built in overclocking feature (buttons ftw)
[/quote] Well played. I couldn’t find a x6 with 3.4Ghz stock, you sure you didn’t mean a x4?
But price wise the intel processor in the mac is more than any of AMD’s x6 phenom series. I have no idea why…[/quote]

because most intel quad-core CPUs shit on their hexa-core CPUs.

[quote=“shrogg, post:43, topic:396197”]Yeah, i guess it is,
Well i think i would like them more if people dident make them up to be more than they actually are. (and if apple lowered the prices by a fucktonne)

Dont get that HDD, they are ment for backups, not as a main storage drive
They are also really slow (hence the price/storage space)

Two of these should work great (Very nice hdd’s, and for the price too)

yes, i mean a IMac 27"

And if i wanted to buy a screen with it, it would cost around $300 extra
Those macs are (atm) 2.7k
[/quote][code] # 27-inch LED-backlit glossy widescreen display with IPS technology, a 2560 x 1440-pixel resolution, 16:9 aspect ratio, 375 cd/m2 brightness rating, and 178-degree viewing angle (horizontal and vertical). Supports input from external DisplayPort sources (adapters sold separately) and is wall-mountable with optional VESA Mount Adapter Kit.

2.8 GHz Intel Core i5 quad-core processor (8 MB shared L3 cache).

1 TB Serial ATA hard drive (7200 RPM)

4 GB installed RAM (1066 MHz DDR3; supports up to 16 GB)

ATI Radeon HD 5750 graphics processor (with 1 GB of DDR3 SDRAM shared with main memory) with enhanced performance for graphics-intensive applications such as games and video editors.

8x slot-loading SuperDrive with double-layer DVD support (DVD±R DL/DVD±RW/

Built-in iSight camera for video chatting

Wi-Fi wireless networking (based on 802.11n specification; 802.11a/b/g compatible)

Gigabit Ethernet wired networking (10/100/1000BASE-T)

Bluetooth 2.1 + EDR (Enhanced Data Rate) for connecting with peripherals such as keyboards, mice and cell phones

Side-loading SDXC card slot

Four USB 2.0 ports, one FireWire 800 port

Mini DisplayPort video output with optional adapters for DVI and VGA output

Built-in stereo speakers with two internal 17-watt high-efficiency amplifiers along with built-in microphone, optical digital audio output/headphone out, optical digital audio input/audio line in

Dimensions: 25.6 x 8.15 x 20.4 inches (WxDxH)

Weight: 30.5 pounds [/code]

amazon.com

Amazon.com: Apple iMac MC511LL/A 27-Inch Desktop (OLD VERSION): Computers & Accessories

The ultimate all-in-one. Turbocharged. The new iMac is the ultimate all-in-one computer. Its Intel Core i5 processor feature an advanced architecture and set new benchmarks for iMac performance. And f ...


It’s 1.6k yours is 1.5k
See it’s not as big of a rip off as you may think.[/quote]
did you even compare the specs…

item.title: Maxing out my Mac Mini
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

[quote=“shrogg, post:36, topic:396197”]I use the latest 24" macs, every week day from 8.30 to 12.00, and they do suck
I mean, i compared it to my pc that i have at home, which was 1.5 K cheaper, and it renders the same image 4 times faster…
Im not a fan boy, i just find them to be overrated and over priced.
Just like alienware (3 grand for an i5 system with a nvidia 460? WHAT?)

end of story. (maby)[/quote]
LOL 1.5K cheaper? What kind of mac does your “school” have? A Mac Pro?

amazon.com

Amazon.com: Apple Mac Pro MC560LL/A Desktop (OLD VERSION): Computers & Accessories

Thanks to the next-generation Quad-Core Intel Xeon “Nehalem” processors and new system architecture, the Mac Pro now delivers performance thatʼs nearly twice as fast as before.(1) Each processor featu ...


That thing can run 64GBs of RAM. and comes stock with a ATI Radeon 5770 graphics card.
If that were your school’s computer, your computer would cost 500$. (Which is about 250$ more than the price of the mac pro’s graphics card alone.)
2000$(mac pro) - 500$ (your computer) = 1,500$ cheaper
And you’re saying your computer out performs something 1.5k$ more expensive?
I hope you were exaggerating.

Read full topic

Damn dude, that’s pretty neat. I got a 24" LG monitor that costed 250$ btw, I suggest you buy one of those. They’re alot cheaper. And since you’re going for that gaming look, you should get some red neon lights to make it look fancy haha. What sort of motherboard are you getting?
[/quote]I was going for the cheapest mobo available with the right socket for the processor I was buying.
Those stuff you saw up there were just stuff I searched online last week, I’ll have to look in more detail to choose my components, but its a rough sketch for what I’m looking for. And I was acctully going to do a completely led installation myself with watercooling. I also might adjust the parts of the computer to have enough to get the hexa core i7 wich costs about 1400 dollars.[/quote]God that’s gunna look so sexy, post a picture when you’re done.

Im not a fan boy, i just find them to be overrated and over priced.

end of story. (maby)[/quote]

Cleaner, i can understand…
faster? what.
Well if you are prepared to spend a few thousand on a mac, then you might as well spend that money on a windows machine and emulate mac on it.

item.title: Maxing out my Mac Mini
item.dc:creator: @shrogg shrogg
item.description:
@shrogg wrote:

[quote=“Java Is My Bitch, post:28, topic:396197”][quote author=shrogg link=topic=493366.msg3610845#msg3610845 date=1306571548]
/rant/

If you like mac so much, then why not buy a Normal windows compatible system, then install Mac OSX 10?
And anyway, you cant upgrade macs, thats why they are shit, and thats how apple gets their money, by making their customers purchase a whole new fucking over priced piece of shit that dosent fucking work.
Trust me, Im using a mac at my 3d modeling class.
and how does atleast 2 crashes a day sound? and they are totally random, there is no knowing when it will happen.
also, what they say about them being better for Graphic design and movie editing is bullshit.
That was only said in the 90’s when the software was only avalible on the mac.
But these times are diferent, im using maya atm, on my windows system, and it hasent crashed once.

Oh, side note.
The crashing on windows is due to badly coded software.
The crashing on mac is due to the bad operating system.
Macs have no error reporting system, so they cannot fix the crashes, because once the mac has crashed, it has no hope.
Macs are disgusting.

/end rant/


[/quote]You obviously haven’t used any of the new generation macs. And yep, they do have bug reporting system. The old macs were weak, but now in my opinion the new ones are way better than windows. I’ve already stated why I don’t use hackintosh.
One piece of advice, quit swaying towards the things you have and justifying why you have it. God, you’re like one of the PS3/Xbox fanboys who’ve only played the other system like 2 times. I have a Windows desktop, a Linux laptop, and a Macintosh, and I think that the mac is the superior to them all. I’ve never had a program crash once on my mac and linux computers. I’ve never gotten a virus on both my mac and linux computers. And to put it plainly, the same doesn’t go for my windows computer, and although the specs on my windows computer are the best at the moment, my mac is faster at performing tasks. Win7 needs 1GB to run at all, OSX Snow Leopard can go with less than 512mb memory(and still run smoothly), and Linux can do with less.
Damn nice internet service.

[quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=493366.msg3610839#msg3610839 date=1306570663]
I didn’t even think you could ‘customise’ mac hardware as such, I thought what you get was what you stuck with.

Bleh, yea my graphics card is built into the motherboard (Intel GMA 950), I’m going to switch out the motherboard and get a beastmode Gcard as well.
Also i’m looking into getting a water cooling system, but so far I’ve had no luck finding guides, i think I’ll ask the shop.
and I can’t over clock since it’s a Macintosh.

Don’t bother getting an i7 if you have integrated graphics…

[/quote]I’ve seen tutorials on swapping motherboards, so it should be all good.[/quote]

I use the latest 24" macs, every week day from 8.30 to 12.00, and they do suck
I mean, i compared it to my pc that i have at home, which was 1.5 K cheaper, and it renders the same image 4 times faster…
Im not a fan boy, i just find them to be overrated and over priced.
Just like alienware (3 grand for an i5 system with a nvidia 460? WHAT?)

end of story. (maby)

Read full topic

[quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=493366.msg3608312#msg3608312 date=1306317412]
Done. I recently bought a 640gb hdd for my lappy, now have a total of 5 hard drives, 3 internal, 2 external.
[/quote]Nice, you have 3 internal harddrives? o.O
All at the same time? Doesn’t it get hot?
[/quote]I think he meant one harddrive internal, 3 partitions, I can’t imagina a laptop with 3 HDD’s, that’s just plain wrong.

Also, my dad gave me 2000 dollars a week ago for bulding him the BEST possile computer within that budget.
[/quote]Oh lol.
So, what are you thinking of getting for his computer? With 2k you can get one beast of a computer, haha.
[/quote]Indeed I can, I was thinking the following:

I already made sure it fits the budget,

  • HP 24 inch screen http://forcom.be/?product=310919
  • this case http://www.forcom.be/?product=305918
  • Intel 1366 Quad Core I7 970 3.2GHz http://forcom.be/?product=307026
  • Gainward nvidia GTX580 1.5GB CUDA PHANTOM http://forcom.be/?product=311176
  • Cooler Master 850W Silent pro http://forcom.be/?product=306202
  • this Western Digital 3 Terrabyte HDD http://forcom.be/?product=308086

The other stuff is pretty much details I don’t need to mention.[/quote]

anandtech.com

CPU Benchmarks - Compare Products on AnandTech

CPU benchmarks: Compare two products side-by-side or see a cascading list of product ratings along with our annotations.

i would go for the sandy bridge CPUs if you are going for keeping the price that low, otherwise go for a 980x/990x.
